page.title: 07OLD MR.CLOUGH OF HALTON
page.content: There were 60 pupils in the school when Mr. Clough went, and he left at 14. The village had two windmills which were worked by cloth covered sails which, when released, the wind blew through and allowed the stones to start grinding the corn. The first house out of Spilsby was called the Tan House where they used to kill animals and dry the skins and make it into leather. There was a wood yard, where wagons and carts were made, and a Blacksmith's Shop where the irons for the carts were made, and the horses were shoed. There was a Butcher's Shop, and two general stores, one supporting a Post Office. The village had a Pinfold, which was a brick square with doors, and any stray animals were locked into this until they were claimed.
